sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Typed letter from UE (Josef Weinberger) to Schenker, dated March 11, 1905
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: [Handel Organ Concertos, vol.1:] UE lists the six persons to whom it has sent complimentary copies.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: UE; Weinberger, Josef; Schenker, Heinrich; Handel, Georg F.; organ concertos; vol. I; complimentary copies; Frimmel, Theodor; Hirschfeld, Robert; Fischer, Jacob; Loewe, Ferdinand; Ludwig, Ernst; Schultz, Detlef

tei:p.tei:hi: Typed letter from UE (Josef Weinberger) to Schenker, dated March 11, 1905

tei:transcription.tei:p: Hochwolgeboren Herrn Professor [/] Dr. Heinrich Schenker, W I E N.
Wir teilen Ihnen höflichst mit, dass wir heute an die uns angegebenen Adressen:

Herrn Dr. Theodor Frimmel, W i e n, Click on: :Theodor Frimmel. Herrn Dr. Robert Hirschfeld, W i e n, Click on: Robert Hirschfeld. Herrn Prof. Jacob Fischer, W i e n, Click on: Jakob Fischer. Herrn Musik Dir. Ferd. Loewe, W i e n, Click on: Ferdinand Löwe. Herrn Prof. Ernst Ludwig, W i e n, Ernst Ludwig (18??-1915), piano professor at the Vienna Conservatory 1883-1909; S's piano teacher in Vienna 1887-90. S credited Ludwig with being the first to take note of his compositions, with introducing him to Julius Epstein, and with entrusting him to the Eissler family (patrons) and to Irene Grädener (Federhofer, Nach Tagebüchern, p.7.). Herrn Dr. Detlef Schultz, L e i p z i g, Detlef Schultz: [identify].
je ein Exemplar Ihrer Bearbeitung von U.E. N<sup>o.</sup> 936 “Haendel Orgel-Konzerte” Vol.I, published March 11, 1905, according to Verlagsdruckbuch UE 936. sandten.-
Wir zeichnen mit dem Ausdrucke vorzueglichster Hochachtung [stamp:] “Universal-Edition” Actiengesellschaft [stamp:] Josef Weinberger

tei:p.tei:hi: Typed letter from UE (Josef Weinberger) to Schenker, dated March 11, 1905

tei:translation.tei:p: Professor Heinrich Schenker, Esq., V I E N N A
We have the pleasure of informing you that we have today sent to the addresses given to us:
Dr. Theodor Frimmel, Vienna, Dr. Robert Hirschfeld, Vienna, Prof. Jacob Fischer, Vienna, Music Dir. Ferd. Loewe, Vienna, Prof. Ernst Ludwig, Vienna, Dr. Detlef Schultz, Leipzig,
one copy each of your edition of U.E. No. 936, “Handel Organ Concertos.”
We remain Most respectfully yours, [stamp:] Universal Edition & Co. [stamp:] Josef Weinberger
